import java.time.LocalDateTime;

/**
 * SMOSServer class simulates connection to the SMOS (School Management Operating System) server.
 * This class handles server connection, status tracking, and interruption as required
 * by the postconditions of the delete teaching use case.
 */
public class SMOSServer {
    private boolean isConnected;
    private String serverAddress;
    private LocalDateTime connectionTime;
    private int connectionAttempts;
    private String sessionId;
    
    // Default server configuration
    private static final String DEFAULT_SERVER_ADDRESS = "smos.education.gov:8443";
    private static final int MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS = 3;
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new SMOSServer instance with default server address.
     */
    public SMOSServer() {
        this.serverAddress = DEFAULT_SERVER_ADDRESS;
        this.isConnected = false;
        this.connectionAttempts = 0;
        this.sessionId = null;
        this.connectionTime = null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new SMOSServer instance with custom server address.
     * 
     * @param serverAddress The address of the SMOS server
     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if serverAddress is null or empty
     */
    public SMOSServer(String serverAddress) {
        if (serverAddress == null || serverAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Server address cannot be null or empty.");
        }
        this.serverAddress = serverAddress.trim();
        this.isConnected = false;
        this.connectionAttempts = 0;
        this.sessionId = null;
        this.connectionTime = null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Attempts to connect to the SMOS server.
     * Simulates server connection with authentication and session creation.
     * 
     * @return true if connection is successful, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean connect() {
        if (isConnected) {
            System.out.println("Already connected to SMOS server at " + serverAddress);
            return true;
        }
        
        System.out.println("Attempting to connect to SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");
        
        // Simulate connection attempt
        connectionAttempts++;
        
        // In a real system, this would involve network calls, authentication, etc.
        // For simulation, assume connection is usually successful
        boolean success = simulateConnection();
        
        if (success) {
            isConnected = true;
            connectionTime = LocalDateTime.now();
            sessionId = generateSessionId();
            
            System.out.println("Successfully connected to SMOS server.");
            System.out.println("Session ID: " + sessionId);
            System.out.println("Connection time: " + connectionTime);
        } else {
            System.out.println("Failed to connect to SMOS server.");
            
            // Attempt reconnection if under maximum attempts
            if (connectionAttempts < MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS) {
                System.out.println("Will attempt reconnection... (" + 
                                 connectionAttempts + "/" + MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS + ")");
            }
        }
        
        return success;
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates a server connection attempt.
     * In a real implementation, this would contain actual network and authentication logic.
     * 
     * @return true if simulated connection succeeds, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean simulateConnection() {
        // For simulation purposes, assume 90% success rate
        // In production, this would involve actual network connectivity checks
        // and authentication with the SMOS server
        double successProbability = 0.9;
        return Math.random() < successProbability;
    }
    
    /**
     * Generates a unique session ID for the server connection.
     * In a real system, this would be provided by the server.
     * 
     * @return A simulated session ID
     */
    private String generateSessionId() {
        String timestamp = String.valueOf(System.currentTimeMillis());
        String random = String.valueOf((int)(Math.random() * 10000));
        return "SMOS_SESSION_" + timestamp + "_" + random;
    }
    
    /**
     * Disconnects from the SMOS server gracefully.
     * This is a normal disconnection initiated by the user/system.
     * 
     * @return true if disconnection is successful, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean disconnect() {
        if (!isConnected) {
            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Nothing to disconnect.");
            return false;
        }
        
        System.out.println("Disconnecting from SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");
        
        // Simulate sending logout/termination request to server
        boolean success = simulateDisconnection();
        
        if (success) {
            System.out.println("Successfully disconnected from SMOS server.");
            System.out.println("Session " + sessionId + " terminated.");
            
            // Log connection duration
            if (connectionTime != null) {
                LocalDateTime disconnectTime = LocalDateTime.now();
                long minutes = java.time.Duration.between(connectionTime, disconnectTime).toMinutes();
                System.out.println("Connection duration: " + minutes + " minutes");
            }
            
            // Reset connection state
            resetConnectionState();
        } else {
            System.out.println("Failed to disconnect gracefully. Forcing disconnection...");
            forceDisconnect();
        }
        
        return success;
    }
    
    /**
     * Interrupts the connection to the SMOS server.
     * This simulates the postcondition "Connection to the SMOS server interrupted"
     * after a teaching deletion. It's an abrupt termination rather than graceful disconnection.
     * 
     * @return true if interruption is successful, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean interruptConnection() {
        if (!isConnected) {
            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Cannot interrupt.");
            return false;
        }
        
        System.out.println("INTERRUPTING connection to SMOS server...");
        System.out.println("This simulates the postcondition after teaching deletion.");
        
        // Force immediate disconnection without graceful shutdown
        forceDisconnect();
        
        System.out.println("Connection to SMOS server has been INTERRUPTED.");
        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: Connection to the SMOS server interrupted");
        
        return true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates a graceful disconnection from the server.
     * 
     * @return true if simulated disconnection succeeds, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean simulateDisconnection() {
        // For simulation purposes, assume 95% success rate for graceful disconnection
        // In production, this would involve sending termination requests to the server
        double successProbability = 0.95;
        return Math.random() < successProbability;
    }
    
    /**
     * Forces immediate disconnection without server coordination.
     * Used for interruption and when graceful disconnection fails.
     */
    private void forceDisconnect() {
        // Force immediate disconnection
        resetConnectionState();
        System.out.println("Forced disconnection complete.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Resets all connection-related state variables.
     */
    private void resetConnectionState() {
        isConnected = false;
        // Don't reset connectionAttempts to maintain attempt count
        sessionId = null;
        connectionTime = null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Checks if currently connected to the SMOS server.
     * 
     * @return true if connected, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean isConnected() {
        return isConnected;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the current server address.
     * 
     * @return The SMOS server address
     */
    public String getServerAddress() {
        return serverAddress;
    }
    
    /**
     * Changes the server address.
     * Note: Will disconnect if currently connected.
     * 
     * @param newAddress The new server address
     * @return true if address was changed successfully, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean changeServerAddress(String newAddress) {
        if (newAddress == null || newAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("Error: New server address cannot be null or empty.");
            return false;
        }
        
        // Disconnect from current server if connected
        if (isConnected) {
            System.out.println("Changing server address while connected. Disconnecting first...");
            disconnect();
        }
        
        String oldAddress = this.serverAddress;
        this.serverAddress = newAddress.trim();
        System.out.println("Server address changed from " + oldAddress + " to " + this.serverAddress);
        
        return true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Sends a test ping to the SMOS server to check connectivity.
     * 
     * @return true if server responds to ping, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean pingServer() {
        if (!isConnected) {
            System.out.println("Cannot ping server: Not connected.");
            return false;
        }
        
        System.out.println("Pinging SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");
        
        // Simulate network latency and response
        boolean success = simulatePing();
        
        if (success) {
            System.out.println("Ping successful. Server is responsive.");
        } else {
            System.out.println("Ping failed. Server may be unreachable.");
        }
        
        return success;
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates a ping to the server.
     * 
     * @return true if simulated ping succeeds, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean simulatePing() {
        // For simulation, assume 98% success rate when connected
        // In production, this would involve actual network ping or heartbeat
        double successProbability = 0.98;
        return Math.random() < successProbability;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the number of connection attempts made.
     * 
     * @return The total connection attempts count
     */
    public int getConnectionAttempts() {
        return connectionAttempts;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the current session ID if connected.
     * 
     * @return The session ID, or null if not connected
     */
    public String getSessionId() {
        return sessionId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the connection timestamp if connected.
     * 
     * @return The connection time, or null if not connected
     */
    public LocalDateTime getConnectionTime() {
        return connectionTime;
    }
    
    /**
     * Returns a string representation of the server connection status.
     * 
     * @return String containing server connection information
     */
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return String.format("SMOSServer{address='%s', connected=%s, sessionId=%s}",
                            serverAddress, isConnected, 
                            sessionId != null ? "'" + sessionId + "'" : "null");
    }
}

teachingId) {\n        Teaching teaching = archive.getTeachingById(teachingId);\n        \n        if (teaching == null) {\n            System.out.println("Teaching with ID " + teachingId + " not found.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("=== Detailed Teaching Information ===");\n        System.out.println("Teaching ID: " + teaching.getId());\n teaching.getDescription());\n        System.out.println("Start Date: " + teaching.getStartDate());\n        System.out.println("End Date: " + teaching.getEndDate());\n \n        // Validate description\n        if (description == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate dates\n /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/DeleteTeaching_1766909458/TeachingArchive.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.util.HashMap;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\nimport java.util.Collections;\nimport java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;\n\n/**\n * Manages a collection of teachings in the archive.\n * Provides functionality to add, retrieve, and delete teachings.\n * Implements thread-safe operations for concurrent access.\n */\npublic class TeachingArchive {\n    private Map<Integer, Teaching> teachings;\n    private ReentrantReadWriteLock lock;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new empty TeachingArchive.\n     */\n    public TeachingArchive() {\n        this.teachings = new HashMap<>();\n        this.lock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock(true); // Fair lock for thread safety\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a teaching to the archive.\n     * Validates that the teaching is not null and that no teaching with the same ID exists.\n     * \n     * @param teaching The teaching to add\n     * @return true if the teaching was added successfully, false if a teaching with the same ID already exists\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teaching is null\n     */\n    public boolean addTeaching(Teaching teaching) {\n        if (teaching == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            int teachingId = teaching.getId();\n            \n            // Check if teaching with the same ID already exists\n            if (teachings.containsKey(teachingId)) {\n                System.out.println("Warning: Teaching with ID " + teachingId + " already exists in archive.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            teachings.put(teachingId, teaching);\n            System.out.println("Teaching added to archive: " + teaching.getCourseName() + " (ID: " + teachingId + ")");\n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Deletes a teaching from the archive.\n     * Only administrators can delete teachings.\n     * Follows the sequence described in use case: eliminate teaching from archive.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching to delete\n     * @param admin The administrator attempting the deletion\n     * @return true if the teaching was deleted successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid or admin is null\n     * @throws SecurityException if the administrator doesn\'t have delete permission\n     */\n    public boolean deleteTeaching(int teachingId, Administrator admin) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        if (admin == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Administrator cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if admin has delete permission\n        if (!admin.hasDeletePermission()) {\n            throw new SecurityException("Administrator does not have permission to delete teachings.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            if (!teachings.containsKey(teachingId)) {\n                System.out.println("Teaching with ID " + teachingId + " not found in archive.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            Teaching teachingToDelete = teachings.get(teachingId);\n            \n            // Additional validation: Check if teaching can be deleted\n            // (e.g., check if it\'s currently active)\n            if (teachingToDelete.isCurrentlyActive()) {\n                System.out.println("Warning: Teaching \'" + teachingToDelete.getCourseName() + \n                                 "\' is currently active. Proceeding with deletion anyway.");\n            }\n            \n            // Remove teaching from archive\n            teachings.remove(teachingId);\n            System.out.println("Teaching deleted from archive: " + \n                             teachingToDelete.getCourseName() + " (ID: " + teachingId + ")");\n            \n            // Log the deletion for audit purposes\n            admin.logDeletion(teachingId, teachingToDelete.getCourseName());\n            \n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Retrieves all teachings from the archive.\n     * Returns an unmodifiable list to prevent external modification.\n     * \n     * @return List of all teachings in the archive\n     */\n    public List<Teaching> getAllTeachings() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            // Return a defensive copy to prevent modification of internal data\n            return Collections.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(teachings.values()));\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Retrieves a teaching by its ID.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching to retrieve\n     * @return The teaching with the specified ID, or null if not found\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid\n     */\n    public Teaching getTeachingById(int teachingId) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.get(teachingId);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if a teaching with the specified ID exists in the archive.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID to check\n     * @return true if a teaching with the ID exists, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean containsTeaching(int teachingId) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.containsKey(teachingId);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the number of teachings in the archive.\n     * \n     * @return The total count of teachings\n     */\n    public int getTeachingCount() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.size();\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets teachings taught by a specific instructor.\n     * \n     * @param instructorName The name of the instructor\n     * @return List of teachings by the specified instructor\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if instructorName is null or empty\n     */\n    public List<Teaching> getTeachingsByInstructor(String instructorName) {\n        if (instructorName == null || instructorName.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Instructor name cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            List<Teaching> result = new ArrayList<>();\n            String normalizedName = instructorName.trim();\n            \n            for (Teaching teaching : teachings.values()) {\n                if (teaching.getInstructor().equalsIgnoreCase(normalizedName)) {\n                    result.add(teaching);\n                }\n            }\n            \n            return Collections.unmodifiableList(result);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all teachings from the archive (for testing/reset purposes).\n     * Admin permission is required for this operation.\n     * \n     * @param admin The administrator attempting the operation\n     * @return true if the archive was cleared successfully\n     * @throws SecurityException if the administrator doesn\'t have permission\n     */\n    public boolean clearArchive(Administrator admin) {\n        if (admin == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Administrator cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        if (!admin.hasClearArchivePermission()) {\n            throw new SecurityException("Administrator does not have permission to clear the archive.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            int count = teachings.size();\n            teachings.clear();\n            System.out.println("Archive cleared. Removed " + count + " teachings.");\n            \n            // Log the clear operation for audit purposes\n            admin.logArchiveClear(count);\n            \n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the archive status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing archive statistics\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return "TeachingArchive{teachingsCount=" + teachings.size() + "}";\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the TeachingArchive.java file with comprehensive functionality for managing teachings, including the deleteTeaching method that follows the use case requirements. file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/DeleteTeaching_1766909458/Administrator.java has been successfully created, with content:\npackage workspace;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.util.List;\n\n/**\n * Represents an administrator user with authentication and permission management.\n * This class handles administrator login, permissions, and logging of actions\n * for audit purposes as required by the delete teaching use case.\n */\npublic class Administrator {\n    private String username;\n    private String passwordHash; // In a real system, passwords should be hashed\n    private boolean isLoggedIn;\n    private boolean hasDeletePermission;\n    private boolean hasClearArchivePermission;\n    private List<String> actionLog;\n    \n    // Default administrator credentials (for demonstration)\n    private static final String DEFAULT_USERNAME = "admin";\n    private static final String DEFAULT_PASSWORD = "admin123"; // In production, use secure password hashing\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new Administrator with default credentials.\n     * By default, administrators have delete permission but must log in first.\n     */\n    public Administrator() {\n        this.username = DEFAULT_USERNAME;\n        this.passwordHash = hashPassword(DEFAULT_PASSWORD); // Simple hash for demonstration\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.hasDeletePermission = true; // Administrators typically have delete permission\n        this.hasClearArchivePermission = true; // Administrators can clear archive\n        this.actionLog = new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new Administrator with custom credentials.\n     * \n     * @param username The administrator\'s username\n     * @param password The administrator\'s password (will be hashed)\n     */\n    public Administrator(String username, String password) {\n        if (username == null || username.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Username cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Password cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        \n        this.username = username.trim();\n        this.passwordHash = hashPassword(password);\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.hasDeletePermission = true;\n        this.hasClearArchivePermission = true;\n        this.actionLog = new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to log in the administrator.\n     * Simulates authentication by checking credentials.\n     * \n     * @return true if login is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean login() {\n        return login(DEFAULT_USERNAME, DEFAULT_PASSWORD);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to log in the administrator with provided credentials.\n     * \n     * @param inputUsername The username to authenticate\n     * @param inputPassword The password to authenticate\n     * @return true if login is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean login(String inputUsername, String inputPassword) {\n        if (inputUsername == null || inputPassword == null) {\n            logAction("Login attempted with null credentials", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check credentials\n        boolean success = username.equals(inputUsername.trim()) && \n                         checkPassword(inputPassword, passwordHash);\n        \n        if (success) {\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            logAction("User \'" + username + "\' logged in successfully", true);\n            System.out.println("Administrator " + username + " is now logged in.");\n        } else {\n            logAction("Failed login attempt for username: " + inputUsername, false);\n            System.out.println("Login failed: Invalid credentials.");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the administrator.\n     * \n     * @return true if logout is successful, false if not logged in\n     */\n    public boolean logout() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("No user is currently logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        logAction("User \'" + username + "\' logged out", true);\n        System.out.println("Administrator " + username + " has been logged out.");\n        isLoggedIn = false;\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the administrator has delete permission.\n     * Note: Administrator must be logged in to exercise permissions.\n     * \n     * @return true if administrator has delete permission and is logged in\n     */\n    public boolean hasDeletePermission() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Checking permissions while not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        return hasDeletePermission;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the administrator has clear archive permission.\n     * Note: Administrator must be logged in to exercise permissions.\n     * \n     * @return true if administrator has clear archive permission and is logged in\n     */\n    public boolean hasClearArchivePermission() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Checking permissions while not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        return hasClearArchivePermission;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a password hashing function.\n     * In a real system, use a secure hashing algorithm like bcrypt, scrypt, or Argon2.\n     * \n     * @param password The plain text password\n     * @return A simulated hash of the password\n     */\n    private String hashPassword(String password) {\n        // This is a simple simulation for demonstration purposes\n        // In production, use: return BCrypt.hashpw(password, BCrypt.gensalt());\n        return "hashed_" + password.hashCode();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the provided plain text password matches the stored hash.\n     * \n     * @param plainPassword The plain text password to check\n     * @param storedHash The stored password hash\n     * @return true if the password matches the hash, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean checkPassword(String plainPassword, String storedHash) {\n        // In a real system, use: return BCrypt.checkpw(plainPassword, storedHash);\n        String inputHash = hashPassword(plainPassword);\n        return storedHash.equals(inputHash);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs an administrator action for audit purposes.\n     * \n     * @param actionDescription Description of the action performed\n     * @param success Whether the action was successful\n     */\n    public void logAction(String actionDescription, boolean success) {\n        String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().toString();\n        String status = success ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILURE";\n        String logEntry = String.format("[%s] [%s] %s - User: %s", \n                                        timestamp, status, actionDescription, username);\n        actionLog.add(logEntry);\n        \n        // In a real system, also write to a file or database\n        System.out.println("Action logged: " + logEntry);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs the deletion of a teaching for audit purposes.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching that was deleted\n     * @param courseName The name of the course that was deleted\n     */\n    public void logDeletion(int teachingId, String courseName) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Logging deletion while not logged in.");\n        }\n        \n        String action = String.format("Deleted teaching - ID: %d, Course: %s", \n                                     teachingId, courseName);\n        logAction(action, true);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs the clearing of the archive for audit purposes.\n     * \n     * @param teachingsCount The number of teachings that were cleared\n     */\n    public void logArchiveClear(int teachingsCount) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Logging archive clear while not logged in.");\n        }\n        \n        String action = String.format("Cleared archive - Incorrect old password", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newPassword == null || newPassword.isEmpty()) {\n            logAction("Password change failed - New password is invalid", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Update password hash\n        passwordHash = hashPassword(newPassword);\n        logAction("Password changed successfully", true);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the administrator status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing administrator information\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return String.format("Administrator{username=\'%s\', loggedIn=%s, hasDeletePermission=%s}",\n                            username, isLoggedIn, hasDeletePermission);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the Administrator.java file with comprehensive functionality for administrator authentication, permission management, and action logging. delete teaching use case.\n */\npublic class SMOSServer {\n    private boolean isConnected;\n    private String serverAddress;\n    private LocalDateTime connectionTime;\n    private int Constructs a new SMOSServer instance with custom server address.\n     * \n     * @param serverAddress The address of the SMOS server\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if serverAddress is null or empty\n     */\n    public SMOSServer(String serverAddress) {\n        if (serverAddress == null || serverAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Server address cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        this.serverAddress = serverAddress.trim();\n        this.isConnected = false;\n        this.connectionAttempts = 0;\n        this.sessionId = null;\n        this.connectionTime = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to connect to the SMOS server.\n     * Simulates server connection with authentication and session creation.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean connect() {\n        if (isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Already connected to SMOS server at " + serverAddress);\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Attempting to connect to SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate connection attempt\n        connectionAttempts++;\n        \n        // In a real system, this would involve network calls, authentication, etc.\n        // For simulation, assume connection is usually successful\n        boolean success = simulateConnection();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            isConnected = true;\n            connectionTime = LocalDateTime.now();\n System.out.println("Connection time: " + connectionTime);\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Failed to connect to SMOS server.");\n            \n            // Attempt reconnection if under maximum attempts\n            if (connectionAttempts < MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS) {\n                System.out.println("Will attempt reconnection... (" + \n                                 connectionAttempts + "/" + MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection attempt.\n     * In a real implementation, this would contain actual network and authentication logic.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated connection succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulateConnection() {\n        // For simulation purposes, assume 90% success rate\n        // In production, this would involve actual network connectivity checks\n        // and authentication with the SMOS server\n        double successProbability = 0.9;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generates a unique session ID for the server connection.\n     * In a real system, this would be provided by the server.\n     * \n     * @return A simulated session ID\n     */\n    private String generateSessionId() {\n        String timestamp = String.valueOf(System.currentTimeMillis());\n        String random = String.valueOf((int)(Math.random() * 10000));\n        return "SMOS_SESSION_" + timestamp + "_" + random;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Disconnects from the SMOS server gracefully.\n     * This is a normal disconnection initiated by the user/system.\n     * \n     * @return true if disconnection is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean disconnect() {\n        if (!isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Nothing to disconnect.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Disconnecting from SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate sending logout/termination request to server\n        boolean success = simulateDisconnection();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            System.out.println("Successfully disconnected from SMOS server.");\n            System.out.println("Session " + sessionId + " terminated.");\n            \n            // Log connection duration\n            if (connectionTime != null) {\n                LocalDateTime disconnectTime = LocalDateTime.now();\n                long minutes = java.time.Duration.between(connectionTime, disconnectTime).toMinutes();\n                System.out.println("Connection duration: " + minutes + " minutes");\n            }\n            \n            // Reset connection state\n            resetConnectionState();\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Failed to disconnect gracefully. It\'s an abrupt termination rather than graceful disconnection.\n     * \n     * @return true if interruption is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean interruptConnection() {\n        if (!isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Cannot interrupt.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("INTERRUPTING connection to SMOS server...");\n        System.out.println("This simulates the postcondition after teaching deletion.");\n        \n        // Force immediate disconnection without graceful shutdown\n        forceDisconnect();\n        \n        System.out.println("Connection to SMOS server has been INTERRUPTED.");\n        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: Connection to the SMOS server interrupted");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a graceful disconnection from the server.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated disconnection succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulateDisconnection() {\n        // For simulation purposes, assume 95% success rate for graceful disconnection\n        // In production, this would involve sending termination requests to the server\n        double successProbability = 0.95;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Forces immediate disconnection without server coordination.\n     * Used for interruption and when graceful disconnection fails.\n     */\n    private void forceDisconnect() {\n        // Force immediate disconnection\n        resetConnectionState();\n        System.out.println("Forced disconnection complete.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Resets all connection-related state variables.\n     */\n    private void resetConnectionState() {\n        isConnected = false;\n        // changeServerAddress(String newAddress) {\n        if (newAddress == null || newAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: New server address cannot be null or empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Disconnect from current server if connected\n        if (isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Changing server address while connected. Server is responsive.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Ping failed. Server may be unreachable.");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a ping to the server.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated ping succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulatePing() {\n        // For simulation, assume 98% success rate when connected\n        // In production, this would involve actual network ping or heartbeat\n        double successProbability = 0.98;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the number of connection attempts made.\n     * \n     * @return The total connection attempts count\n     */\n    public int getConnectionAttempts() {\n        return connectionAttempts;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current session ID if connected.\n     * \n     * @return The session ID, or null if not connected\n     */\n    public String getSessionId() {\n        return sessionId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the connection timestamp if connected.\n     * \n     * @return The connection time, or null if not connected\n     */\n    public LocalDateTime getConnectionTime() {\n        return connectionTime;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the server connection status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing server connection information\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return String.format("SMOSServer{address=\'%s\', connected=%s, sessionId=%s}",\n                            serverAddress, isConnected, \n                            sessionId != null ? This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after. The insert content will be add between the line of line_number-1 and line_number insert_content (str): The content to insert betweed the previous_line_content and current_line_content.The insert_content must be a complete block of code at. NOTE: This tool is exclusive. If you use this tool, you cannot use any other commands in the current response. If you need to use it multiple times, wait for the next turn."}, "open_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Opens the file at the given path in the editor. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. manage the collection of teachings and provide the delete functionality as specified in the use case.\n\n```json\n[\n    {\n        "command_name": "Engineer2.write_new_code",\n        "args": {\n            "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/DeleteTeaching_1766909458/TeachingArchive.java",\n            "file_description": "TeachingArchive class that manages a collection of teachings, provides add, delete, and retrieval functionality with proper validation and error handling"\n        }\n    }\n]'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/DeleteTeaching_1766909458/TeachingArchive.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.util.HashMap;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\nimport java.util.Collections;\nimport java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;\n\n/**\n * Manages a collection of teachings in the archive.\n * Provides functionality to add, retrieve, and delete teachings.\n * Implements thread-safe operations for concurrent access.\n */\npublic class TeachingArchive {\n    private Map<Integer, Teaching> teachings;\n    private ReentrantReadWriteLock lock;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new empty TeachingArchive.\n     */\n    public TeachingArchive() {\n        this.teachings = new HashMap<>();\n        this.lock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock(true); // Fair lock for thread safety\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a teaching to the archive.\n     * Validates that the teaching is not null and that no teaching with the same ID exists.\n     * \n     * @param teaching The teaching to add\n     * @return true if the teaching was added successfully, false if a teaching with the same ID already exists\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teaching is null\n     */\n    public boolean addTeaching(Teaching teaching) {\n        if (teaching == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            int teachingId = teaching.getId();\n            \n            // Check if teaching with the same ID already exists\n            if (teachings.containsKey(teachingId)) {\n                System.out.println("Warning: Teaching with ID " + teachingId + " already exists in archive.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            teachings.put(teachingId, teaching);\n            System.out.println("Teaching added to archive: " + teaching.getCourseName() + " (ID: " + teachingId + ")");\n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Deletes a teaching from the archive.\n     * Only administrators can delete teachings.\n     * Follows the sequence described in use case: eliminate teaching from archive.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching to delete\n     * @param admin The administrator attempting the deletion\n     * @return true if the teaching was deleted successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid or admin is null\n     * @throws SecurityException if the administrator doesn\'t have delete permission\n     */\n    public boolean deleteTeaching(int teachingId, Administrator admin) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        if (admin == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Administrator cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if admin has delete permission\n        if (!admin.hasDeletePermission()) {\n            throw new SecurityException("Administrator does not have permission to delete teachings.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            if (!teachings.containsKey(teachingId)) {\n                System.out.println("Teaching with ID " + teachingId + " not found in archive.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            Teaching teachingToDelete = teachings.get(teachingId);\n            \n            // Additional validation: Check if teaching can be deleted\n            // (e.g., check if it\'s currently active)\n            if (teachingToDelete.isCurrentlyActive()) {\n                System.out.println("Warning: Teaching \'" + teachingToDelete.getCourseName() + \n                                 "\' is currently active. Proceeding with deletion anyway.");\n            }\n            \n            // Remove teaching from archive\n            teachings.remove(teachingId);\n            System.out.println("Teaching deleted from archive: " + \n                             teachingToDelete.getCourseName() + " (ID: " + teachingId + ")");\n            \n            // Log the deletion for audit purposes\n            admin.logDeletion(teachingId, teachingToDelete.getCourseName());\n            \n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Retrieves all teachings from the archive.\n     * Returns an unmodifiable list to prevent external modification.\n     * \n     * @return List of all teachings in the archive\n     */\n    public List<Teaching> getAllTeachings() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            // Return a defensive copy to prevent modification of internal data\n            return Collections.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(teachings.values()));\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Retrieves a teaching by its ID.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching to retrieve\n     * @return The teaching with the specified ID, or null if not found\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid\n     */\n    public Teaching getTeachingById(int teachingId) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.get(teachingId);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if a teaching with the specified ID exists in the archive.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID to check\n     * @return true if a teaching with the ID exists, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if teachingId is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean containsTeaching(int teachingId) {\n        if (teachingId <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.containsKey(teachingId);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the number of teachings in the archive.\n     * \n     * @return The total count of teachings\n     */\n    public int getTeachingCount() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return teachings.size();\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets teachings taught by a specific instructor.\n     * \n     * @param instructorName The name of the instructor\n     * @return List of teachings by the specified instructor\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if instructorName is null or empty\n     */\n    public List<Teaching> getTeachingsByInstructor(String instructorName) {\n        if (instructorName == null || instructorName.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Instructor name cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            List<Teaching> result = new ArrayList<>();\n            String normalizedName = instructorName.trim();\n            \n            for (Teaching teaching : teachings.values()) {\n                if (teaching.getInstructor().equalsIgnoreCase(normalizedName)) {\n                    result.add(teaching);\n                }\n            }\n            \n            return Collections.unmodifiableList(result);\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all teachings from the archive (for testing/reset purposes).\n     * Admin permission is required for this operation.\n     * \n     * @param admin The administrator attempting the operation\n     * @return true if the archive was cleared throw new IllegalArgumentException("Administrator cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        if (!admin.hasClearArchivePermission()) {\n            throw new SecurityException("Administrator does not have permission to clear the archive.");\n        }\n        \n        lock.writeLock().lock();\n        try {\n            int count = teachings.size();\n            teachings.clear();\n            System.out.println("Archive cleared. Removed " + count + " teachings.");\n            \n            // Log the clear operation for audit purposes\n            admin.logArchiveClear(count);\n            \n            return true;\n        } finally {\n            lock.writeLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the archive status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing archive statistics\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        lock.readLock().lock();\n        try {\n            return "TeachingArchive{teachingsCount=" + teachings.size() + "}";\n        } finally {\n            lock.readLock().unlock();\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the TeachingArchive.java file with comprehensive functionality for managing teachings, including the deleteTeaching method that follows the use case requirements. \n    // Default administrator credentials (for demonstration)\n    private static final String DEFAULT_USERNAME = "admin";\n    private static final String DEFAULT_PASSWORD = "admin123"; // In this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.hasDeletePermission = true;\n        this.hasClearArchivePermission = true;\n        this.actionLog = new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts     return login(DEFAULT_USERNAME, DEFAULT_PASSWORD);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to log in the administrator with provided credentials.\n     * \n     * @param inputUsername The username inputPassword) {\n        if (inputUsername == null || inputPassword == null) {\n            logAction("Login attempted with null credentials", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check credentials\n        boolean success = username.equals(inputUsername.trim()) && \n                         checkPassword(inputPassword, passwordHash);\n        \n        if (success) {\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            logAction("User \'" + username + "\' logged in successfully", true);\n            System.out.println("Administrator " + username + " is now }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the administrator.\n     * \n     * @return true if logout is successful, false if not logged in\n     */\n    public username + "\' logged out", true);\n        System.out.println("Administrator " + username + " has been logged out.");\n        isLoggedIn = false;\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     *      System.out.println("Warning: Checking permissions while not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        return hasClearArchivePermission;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates simulated hash of the password\n     */\n    private String hashPassword(String password) {\n        // This is a simple simulation for demonstration purposes\n        // In production, use: return BCrypt.hashpw(password, BCrypt.gensalt());\n        return "hashed_" + password.hashCode();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the provided plain text password matches the stored hash.\n     * \n     * @param plainPassword The plain text password to check\n     * @param storedHash The stored password hash\n     * @return true if the password matches the hash, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean checkPassword(String plainPassword, String storedHash) {\n        // In a real system, use: return BCrypt.checkpw(plainPassword, storedHash);\n        String inputHash = hashPassword(plainPassword);\n        return storedHash.equals(inputHash);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs an administrator action for audit purposes.\n     * \n     * @param actionDescription Description of the action performed\n     * @param success Whether the action was successful\n     */\n    public void logAction(String actionDescription, boolean success) {\n        String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().toString();\n        String status = success ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILURE";\n        String logEntry = String.format("[%s] [%s] %s - User: %s", \n                                        timestamp, status, actionDescription, username);\n        actionLog.add(logEntry);\n        \n        // In a real system, also write to a file or database\n        System.out.println("Action logged: " + logEntry);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs the deletion of a teaching for audit purposes.\n     * \n     * @param teachingId The ID of the teaching that was deleted\n     * @param courseName The name of the course that was deleted\n     */\n    public void logDeletion(int teachingId, String courseName) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Logging deletion while not logged in.");\n        }\n        \n        String action = String.format("Deleted teaching - Removed %d teachings", teachingsCount);\n        logAction(action, true);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the action log for this administrator.\n     * Returns a defensive copy of the action log.\n     * \n     * @return List of logged actions\n     */\n    public List<String> getActionLog() {\n        return new ArrayList<>(actionLog);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the username of this administrator.\n     * \n     * @return The administrator\'s username\n     */\n    public String getUsername() {\n        return username;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the administrator is currently logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears the action log (for testing/reset purposes).\n     * Requires administrator to be logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if the log was cleared successfully\n     */\n    public boolean clearActionLog() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Cannot clear action log while not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        int count = actionLog.size();\n        actionLog.clear();\n        logAction("Cleared action log - Removed " + count + " entries", true);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Revokes delete permission from this administrator.\n     * In a real system, this would be done by a super-admin or through a role management system.\n     * \n     * @return true if permission was revoked, false if already revoked\n     */\n    public boolean revokeDeletePermission() {\n        if (!hasDeletePermission) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        hasDeletePermission = false;\n        logAction("Delete permission revoked", true);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Grants delete permission to this administrator.\n     * \n     * @return true if permission was granted, false if already granted\n     */\n    public boolean grantDeletePermission() {\n        if (hasDeletePermission) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        hasDeletePermission = true;\n        logAction("Delete permission granted", true);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Changes the administrator\'s password.\n     * Requires the old password for verification.\n     * \n     * @param oldPassword The current password\n     * @param newPassword The new password\n     * @return true if password was changed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean changePassword(String oldPassword, String newPassword) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Must be logged in to change password.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!checkPassword(oldPassword, passwordHash)) {\n            logAction("Password change failed - Incorrect old password", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newPassword == null || newPassword.isEmpty()) {\n            logAction("Password change failed - New password is invalid", false);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Update password hash\n        passwordHash = hashPassword(newPassword);\n        logAction("Password changed successfully", true);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the administrator status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing administrator information\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return String.format("Administrator{username=\'%s\', loggedIn=%s, hasDeletePermission=%s}",\n                            username, isLoggedIn, hasDeletePermission);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the Administrator.java file with comprehensive functionality for administrator authentication, permission management, and action logging. The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/DeleteTeaching_1766909458/SMOSServer.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\n\n/**\n * SMOSServer class simulates connection to the SMOS (School Management Operating System) server.\n * This class handles server connection, status tracking, and interruption as required\n * by the postconditions of the delete teaching use case.\n */\npublic class SMOSServer {\n    private boolean isConnected;\n    private String serverAddress;\n    private LocalDateTime connectionTime;\n    private int connectionAttempts;\n    private String sessionId;\n    \n    // Default server configuration\n    private static final String DEFAULT_SERVER_ADDRESS = "smos.education.gov:8443";\n    private static final int MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new SMOSServer instance with default server address.\n     */\n    public SMOSServer() {\n        this.serverAddress = DEFAULT_SERVER_ADDRESS;\n        this.isConnected = false;\n        this.connectionAttempts = 0;\n        this.sessionId = null;\n        this.connectionTime = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new SMOSServer instance with custom server address.\n     * \n     * @param serverAddress The address of the SMOS server\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if serverAddress is null or empty\n     */\n    public SMOSServer(String serverAddress) {\n        if (serverAddress == null || serverAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Server address cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        this.serverAddress = serverAddress.trim();\n        this.isConnected = false;\n        this.connectionAttempts = 0;\n        this.sessionId = null;\n        this.connectionTime = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to connect to the SMOS server.\n     * Simulates server connection with authentication and session creation.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean connect() {\n        if (isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Already connected to SMOS server at " + serverAddress);\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Attempting to connect to SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate connection attempt\n        connectionAttempts++;\n        \n        // In a real system, this would involve network calls, authentication, etc.\n        // For simulation, assume connection is usually successful\n        boolean success = simulateConnection();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            isConnected = true;\n            connectionTime = LocalDateTime.now();\n            sessionId = generateSessionId();\n            \n            System.out.println("Successfully connected to SMOS server.");\n            System.out.println("Session ID: " + sessionId);\n            System.out.println("Connection time: " + connectionTime);\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Failed to connect to SMOS server.");\n            \n            // Attempt reconnection if under maximum attempts\n            if (connectionAttempts < MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS) {\n                System.out.println("Will attempt reconnection... (" + \n                                 connectionAttempts + "/" + MAX_RECONNECTION_ATTEMPTS + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection attempt.\n     * In a real implementation, this would contain actual network and authentication logic.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated connection succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulateConnection() {\n        // For simulation purposes, assume 90% success rate\n        // In production, this would involve actual network connectivity checks\n        // and authentication with the SMOS server\n        double successProbability = 0.9;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generates a unique session ID for the server connection.\n     * In a real system, this would be provided by the server.\n     * \n     * @return A simulated session ID\n     */\n    private String generateSessionId() {\n        String timestamp = String.valueOf(System.currentTimeMillis());\n        String random = String.valueOf((int)(Math.random() * 10000));\n        return "SMOS_SESSION_" + timestamp + "_" + random;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Disconnects from the SMOS server gracefully.\n     * This is a normal disconnection initiated by the user/system.\n     * \n     * @return true if disconnection is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean disconnect() {\n        if (!isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Nothing to disconnect.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Disconnecting from SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate sending logout/termination request to server\n        boolean success = simulateDisconnection();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            System.out.println("Successfully disconnected from SMOS server.");\n            System.out.println("Session " + sessionId + " terminated.");\n            \n            // Log connection duration\n            if (connectionTime != null) {\n                LocalDateTime disconnectTime = LocalDateTime.now();\n                long minutes = java.time.Duration.between(connectionTime, disconnectTime).toMinutes();\n                System.out.println("Connection duration: " + minutes + " minutes");\n            }\n            \n            // Reset connection state\n            resetConnectionState();\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Failed to disconnect gracefully. Forcing disconnection...");\n            forceDisconnect();\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Interrupts the connection to the SMOS server.\n     * This simulates the postcondition "Connection to the SMOS server interrupted"\n     * after a teaching deletion. It\'s an abrupt termination rather than graceful disconnection.\n     * \n     * @return true if interruption is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean interruptConnection() {\n        if (!isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Not connected to SMOS server. Cannot interrupt.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("INTERRUPTING connection to SMOS server...");\n        System.out.println("This simulates the postcondition after teaching deletion.");\n        \n        // Force immediate disconnection without graceful shutdown\n        forceDisconnect();\n        \n        System.out.println("Connection to SMOS server has been INTERRUPTED.");\n        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: Connection to the SMOS server interrupted");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a graceful disconnection from the server.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated disconnection succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulateDisconnection() {\n        // For simulation purposes, assume 95% success rate for graceful disconnection\n        // In production, this would involve sending termination requests to the server\n        double successProbability = 0.95;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Forces immediate disconnection without server coordination.\n     * Used for interruption and when graceful disconnection fails.\n     */\n    private void forceDisconnect() {\n        // Force immediate disconnection\n        resetConnectionState();\n        System.out.println("Forced disconnection complete.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Resets all connection-related state variables.\n     */\n    private void resetConnectionState() {\n        isConnected = false;\n        // Don\'t reset connectionAttempts to maintain attempt count\n        sessionId = null;\n        connectionTime = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if currently connected to the SMOS server.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isConnected() {\n        return isConnected;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current server address.\n     * \n     * @return The SMOS server address\n     */\n    public String getServerAddress() {\n        return serverAddress;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Changes the server address.\n     * Note: Will disconnect if currently connected.\n     * \n     * @param newAddress The new server address\n     * @return true if address was changed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean changeServerAddress(String newAddress) {\n        if (newAddress == null || newAddress.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: New server address cannot be null or empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Disconnect from current server if connected\n        if (isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Changing server address while connected. Disconnecting first...");\n            disconnect();\n        }\n        \n        String oldAddress = this.serverAddress;\n        this.serverAddress = newAddress.trim();\n        System.out.println("Server address changed from " + oldAddress + " to " + this.serverAddress);\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a test ping to the SMOS server to check connectivity.\n     * \n     * @return true if server responds to ping, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean pingServer() {\n        if (!isConnected) {\n            System.out.println("Cannot ping server: Not connected.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Pinging SMOS server at " + serverAddress + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate network latency and response\n        boolean success = simulatePing();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            System.out.println("Ping successful. Server is responsive.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Ping failed. Server may be unreachable.");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a ping to the server.\n     * \n     * @return true if simulated ping succeeds, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean simulatePing() {\n        // For simulation, assume 98% success rate when connected\n        // In production, this would involve actual network ping or heartbeat\n        double successProbability = 0.98;\n        return Math.random() < successProbability;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the number of connection attempts made.\n     * \n     * @return The total connection attempts count\n     */\n    public int getConnectionAttempts() {\n        return connectionAttempts;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current session ID if connected.\n     * \n     * @return The session ID, or null if not connected\n     */\n    public String getSessionId() {\n        return sessionId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the connection timestamp if connected.\n     * \n     * @return The connection time, or null if not connected\n     */\n    public LocalDateTime getConnectionTime() {\n        return connectionTime;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the server connection status.\n     * \n     * @return String containing server connection information\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return String.format("SMOSServer{address=\'%s\', connected=%s, sessionId=%s}",\n                            serverAddress, isConnected, \n                            sessionId != null ? "\'" + sessionId + "\'" : "null");\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the SMOSServer.java file with comprehensive functionality for simulating server connection, disconnection, and interruption as required by the use case postconditions. encapsulates all the data related to a teaching.\n */\npublic class Teaching {\n    private int id;\n    private String courseName;\n    private String instructor;\n    private String description;\n    private String startDate;\n    private String endDate;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new Teaching object with the specified properties.\n     * Validates the input parameters to ensure data integrity.\n     * \n     * @param id The unique identifier for the teaching\n     * @param courseName The name of the course\n     * @param instructor The name of the instructor\n     * @param description A description of the teaching\n     * @param startDate The start date of the teaching (format: YYYY-MM-DD)\n     * @param endDate The end date of the teaching (format: YYYY-MM-DD)\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any parameter is invalid\n     */\n    public Teaching(int id, String courseName, String instructor, String description, \n                   String startDate, String endDate) {\n        // Validate ID\n        if (id <= 0) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teaching ID must be a positive integer.");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate \n        // Validate description\n        if (description == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be null.");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate dates\n be before start date.");\n            }\n        } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {\n            // This should not happen because validateDate already checks format\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        this.id = id;\n        this.courseName = courseName.trim();\n        this.instructor = instructor.trim();\n        this.description = description;\n        this.startDate = startDate;\n        this.endDate = endDate;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates that a date string is in the correct format (YYYY-MM-DD).\n     * \n     * @param date The date string to validate\n     * @param fieldName The name of the date field (for error messages)\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the date is invalid\n     */\n    private void validateDate(String date, String fieldName) {\n        if (date == null || date.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(fieldName + " cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            LocalDate.parse(date);\n        } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {\n
